Posts.Content: zoeepagee wrote: First time poster, full time worrier. I went in for an ultrasound on a palpable lump on Thursday and only just now found the Radiology Report. I understand it a little bit, but not entirely sure. I am booked in for a biopsy Monday. Right Breast. In the right axillary region, there is a 15 x 8 x 21 mm heterogenous lesion of slightly angulated configuration and internal vascularity. There are no other concerning masses. There is an 8 mm cyst at 10 o'clock. The tissues underlying the nipple-areolar complex likewise normal. Left Breast. A few tiny simple cysts are noted. There are no concerning masses. The tissues underlying the nipple-areolar complex likewise normal. Axillary content is normal. COMMENT. The right axillary lesion is of indeterminate nature, possibly a fibroadenoma in the axillary tail. Ultrasound-guided biopsy is advised. Uncomplicated cysts in the remainder of both breasts. Right breast. BIRADS 4 Left breast. BIRADS 2 Any advice or translations or anything at all would be very appreciated. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Translation to put me at ease, pretty please! zoeepagee Lea7777
